The cells of Algibacter ulvanivorans are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, and rod-shaped. They are aerobic, meaning they require oxygen for growth and metabolism. The optimal growth temperature for this species is around 25-30Â°C.

This ability to break down and consume ulvan is a defining characteristic of this bacterial species, hence the name "ulvanivorans" which means "ulvan-eating."

The genome of Algibacter ulvanivorans has been sequenced, revealing insights into the genetic and metabolic capabilities that allow it to thrive in the algal-associated environment.
